notes.text:
An update for flatpak is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Flatpak is a system for building, distributing, and running sandboxed desktop applications on Linux.

Security Fix(es):

* flatpak: Sandbox bypass via recent VFS-manipulating syscalls (CVE-2021-41133)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the flatpak package. It is susceptible to a software flaw that can deceive portals and other host-OS services into treating the flatpak app as an ordinary, non-sandboxed host-OS process. This flaw allows the escalation of privileges that the corresponding services presume the flatpak app has. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: flatpak: Sandbox bypass via recent VFS-manipulating syscalls
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
